website_summaries.verdict: Cordless trimmer converts to an edger with ease, handling more of your lawn care tasks.
pros: Easily converts from a trimmer to edger
Trimmer can make a wider cutting path, or conserve energy for a longer run time.Ergonomic handle
cons: Cord can release too much and needs to be retracted back

customer_reviews.title: Love my Weedeater!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this weed eater.. I can only do short spurts of yard work due to my physical ability and needed ine I could lift and start easily. This is the answer to my prayer. Easy to use,light and push button start. Does a great cutting job cutting even thick weeds. Havent timed out the battery as yet but have done about 30 minutes and still have charge. Would recommend especially for the ladies.
customer_reviews.author: Dayle M. Price

customer_reviews.title: What a nice addition to my yard toy collection
customer_reviews.text: What a nice addition to my yard toy collection. For years, I used my faithful gas weed eater for all eating needs. It works just fine but is heavy, awkward and noisy. Now, my WG154 makes most jobs a pleasure. The old friend still has use in some places. I can't find a single thing that I do not like about the WG154. The string enclosed did fine even on heavy bushes however, I boughtIt is a bit heavier. Winding the spool is easy. If you have any questions, feel free to ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Koch

customer_reviews.title: ... have used this a couple of times and I like the fact I do not have to mess around ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a couple of times and I like the fact I do not have to mess around with gas and oil. The battery lasts for about 20 minutes, so I would recommend buying another battery if you have a lot to work on. Plus make sure both batteries are charged before yard work, the batteries do take awhile to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Sid W.

customer_reviews.title: Worx Lithium Edger
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 newer edgers from various companies (Black & Decker, Greenworks) and they are junk. Useless. This Worx edger does work. I cannot get the pole to turn in order to use the edger well but I'll manage. What I love: extremely lightweight, easy to assemble, battery is simple to insert & remove, the spool works smooth as silk; auto-feed is spectacular. -- As I haven't changed a spool yet, don't know how easy or hard it is. The edging is OK, not super clean but this could be my inability to twist the stick/pole.
customer_reviews.author: BanTrophyHunting

customer_reviews.title: They are amazing, and especially easy for women to use and ...
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about WORX products ! They are amazing, and especially easy for women to use and handle. This product arrived well-packaged. I would recommend this item and the seller to anyone who needs an excellent weed-wacker ! Hands down, best on the market !
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper in Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the picture, the cord keeps coming out. It is very frustrating to have to stop every couple of minutes and wind it back in. Also, the handle keeps detaching. I wish I had never bought this. I like the fact that it is battery powered and that’s about it. Batteries don’t last very long and I was going to buy a couple spares to switch out. However, I’m not going to invest anymore money into this thing. I’m going to have to get rid of this crappy trimmer and get a better one. Money wasted!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the price. Not a heavy duty trimmer, but works well. Lightweight, self feeding string, (no bumping) and NO cord to plug in. The other thing that I really like, is that they sell pre wound reels of string at a reasonable cost. Haven't had any string issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the stem and handle do not lock into place like it should
customer_reviews.text: This is poorly made, the stem and handle do not lock into place like it should... it has a tendency to come apart. But it is light weight and the motor works well so far, one summer's use. -- Back for to edit this post a year later. Motor and battery continue to be good. I used a dry weld on the handle stem to stop it from coming apart while in use. Very poorly thought out locking mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life, hurts to use.
customer_reviews.text: This weed whacker may be good for someone with a small yard with grass. I have a yard overgrown with dense Texas weeds. The battery only lasts about 10 minutes per charge for me. I need something more heavy duty with lasting power to get my yard done. This just doesn't cut it. It also is not ergonomic and is uncomfortable to use. Two buttons have to be pushed down and constantly held for the mashine to run and it tires out your hand. The stabilizing handle is awkwardly placed and doesn't allow for optimum control and fatigues your arm. I would not recommend and am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Works great, light weight, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought Worx leaf blower this summer, so pleased with its performance, I decided to buy this weedwacker/edger. Recently received it, used it yesterday & am very happy with this product as well. It’s lightweight, easy to use, no bumping-just an easy to push button on the bottom to advance the spool. I bought an extra battery too so I wouldn’t need to stop working to recharge. I used one battery, I did all of my city lot property & even some trimming at 2 of my neighbors & it still wasn’t dead. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: JulieG

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Back to the drawing board. This unit ‘could’ be effective, however the lightweight design is ‘cheap.’ It worked once. After that the edger/trimmer functionality was but a dream. The auto feeder for the string keeps it too short too be effective - be sure and order extra Spools of PREROLLED strong.
customer_reviews.author: DragonFly

customer_reviews.title: Order a larger battery and some trimmer cartridges
customer_reviews.text: My little wife wanted an edge trimmer that she could handle and this fits the bill. Issues that we had immediately: 1) string does not feed smoothly and it hangs. Spool has to be removed and the trim line separated and freed. Unit only comes with a single spool, so order more. 2) 1+ amp-hr battery gives out after 45 minutes. Recommend the 4+ amp-hr purchase (around $35) So, while a bit aggravating, so is edge trimming. This makes edge trimming far less aggravating. I would not discourage anyone from purchasing, just be aware of issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bestoink

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but that’s it!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this purchase. I missed the return date by 3-4 days. I would think it could be extended due to the unprecedented circumstances. I work for Publix so to say I’ve been busy is an understatement. The spool is so small and the one it came with would not dole out the string. I had to stop and pull it out at least 10 times. And of course the 25 volt battery is different from all the other ones I have for my other worx tools. I wouldn’t recommend this unless you just need a tool so light weight because light weight it is. I’ve used Worx tools for 12 years now. They usually are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't trim well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this trimmer to replace my old Black and Decker which I had for at least 10 years. It is light weight and easy to move around, however I find I spend all my time having to manually feed out the line that doesn't last more than thirty seconds before it breaks off. I have a small, light duty yard and mostly just trimming the grass along my fence and walkways. It does a poor job and I have to go over the same area over and over again to get it cut. I should have returned it right away. However in looking at reviews of other trimmers, they all seem just as bad. Good luck with your search.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brodeur

customer_reviews.title: Work swell.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used mine a couple times so the 5 stars is for short term functionality, not long term durability. I'll get back to you in a year or two for that. First impression: this cordless tool is surprisingly powerful. It in no way replaces a gas powered weed whipper but it's not meant to. It works and comes without fumes and grease. I like the way it feeds new line also: you just stop and start it again, that's it. My 72 year old mother-in-law can use it too. Cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchtown

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty close to prefect.
customer_reviews.text: The only con is the way the string comes out. It's not auto feeding or one of those where you stab the ground to make it come out. You have to flip it over and push a button while you pull the string out. This isn't that big if a deal. It works just a little bit of a hassle. I'm in summer 2 of using mine. The battery is great and it does the job. Gets where my lawn mower won't. I can honestly say I'm very pleased. If I had a larger yard I would probably want to get something bigger or another battery. Prefect for my situation. The spool of string lasted an entire summer.
customer_reviews.author: Stimie

customer_reviews.title: WORX Works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is awesome. Ease of use. No bothersome cord, lightweight and manageable. Trims the lawn in no time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Curiosity

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS TRIMMER!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this trimmer, you will change the line in it 2-3 times each time you weed eat your yard. I have only light trimming on a small sized lot. The cordless aspect is nice and the battery power is just enough to finish my yard without a recharge. The line feed, though, is automatic and the spool only holds ten feet. If it even kisses lightly anything other than grass, the line feeds out. I am considering throwing it in the trash and buying a real trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Princehollis

customer_reviews.title: LOVE  this thing!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I didn’t let the bad reviews stop me from ordering this weed eater. I am absolutely blown away by how long the spool of string lasts. Granted, I am not using it on a big yard; just small areas around flower beds but I am so impressed. I’m 77 years old female and it is so light weight and easy to use. Battery lasts a very long time. I used a 3/4 horse power, HEAVY electric trimmer for 20 years, so I really appreciate this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Walk

customer_reviews.title: Very Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: My likes -it’s easier to start and it’s lightweight. My dislikes -it is not auto filling I had to stop several times during the process to manually get more string, the spool is too small and it is too short for me was constantly bending over And the battery on a full charge only lasted 20 minutes I timed it. Therefore I am returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: nanasgranny68

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love my weed-wacker. It actually lasts longer than I expected which means I can use it for about 45 minutes. I bought an extra battery so there is no stopping me for longer jobs. The only thing is that after the first use, I can’t get it to automatic feed the line but it’s easy enough to flip over an manually pull the line longer. It’s a great price for what you get and I can actually chop down semi-heavy weeds. Overall, it’s perfect for trimming grass quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but needs a spare battery
customer_reviews.text: Love this weed eater. I was not sure Id like a cordless, but I love it. Its super light and gets the job done. But like so many others have pointed out, make sure you get an extra battery so when this one runs out, you will have another on the charger ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip D.

customer_reviews.title: Worthy lightweight battery trimmer
customer_reviews.text: So far this trimmer has exceeded expectations. Battery has worked well and has lasted longer than some have used previously. Cord has lasted better than a competitor's model I used to use. Most of use is probably light to medium duty. Needed and wanted a smaller head and lightweight model that could be used by myself and my wife without a cord and anywhere in the yard without concern for outlet/cord or gas. Only have seen a slight issue with auto feed when you first engage the trimmer; does not always seem to feed. It is not a tap on ground and feed cord trimmer. Experience to date has made me want to consider other products by this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve66

customer_reviews.title: Lasting battery life and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: This smaller trimmer works great for me. I have an older shoulder injury that hinders me from using gas powered trimmers and the corded trimmers are too difficult for me to drag the cord behind me. This small trimmer is just what the Doctor ordered for my limitations!!! I was also pleasantly surprised that the battery works long enough for me to trim our yard.
customer_reviews.author: Alta Vista

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to use, does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is lightweight yet does a great job for my yard. I use it to trim back grasses and wild flowers in my desert yard, nothing really heavy duty. It worked better than I thought it would on the thicker stems. Because of its light weight, and the length of the battery life before recharge, I can work for a long time without my arms getting tired. I’m A 70 year old female and would highly recommend it to those who might find a more heavy duty machine hard to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Good for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice trimmer if you have a small area and the grass isn't very thick. It does require some "elbow grease" and a couple of passes for thicker growth. The battery lasted 20 min on the first run. (completed job, battery didn't die). The edging mode was very effective as well. Light weight tool. Only "gripe", is that you must squeeze a trigger to engage power. Can cramp your hand after awhile, especially if trimming a thicker area of weeds or grass. The trim line held up well, even after engaging concrete and some wood fencing. All things considered, a nice value and would highly-recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price, but understand that this is a very light duty tool. Only has one string that spins and cuts. Battery life is good, but we’ll see how long that lasts. It has automatic line feed, which is good and bad. Good because it’s convenient, but bad because it uses more line than it needs to. But still good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, perfect for maintenance
customer_reviews.text: I always hated trying to use gas powered weed whackers. This one is really lightweight, easy to use, battery lasts about 30mins, but the best part is that it is SO HASTLE FREE. You just slap the battery on and hit a button. I use it to trim long grass and plants that grow on the fence lines, around trees, and under the edge of my deck. As long as it lasts a long time i’m really happy with it. Yes, I have to manually pull the string out further but who cares? It takes 2 seconds and I only need to do it once or twice every use.
customer_reviews.author: TCM

customer_reviews.title: Great for average lawn
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect for my property (about 1/3 ac with walkways, trees, garden fencing, etc. to be trimmed around). It's not exactly light, by the time I'm done my wrists know I've been using it, but it's certainly not heavy. The battery charges fairly quickly and lasts long enough for me to trim everything after mowing. Works fine in edging mode. The battery pops in and out easily from the trimmer and charger, but locks in place securely during use. It was strong enough to clear a path through an overgrown perennial bed, including milkweed stems and such. So far this was a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Dana in NY

customer_reviews.title: Handle slides apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace a worx trimmer. It's ok but the handle pieces won't snap together. The original one was edger/trimmer together with wheels for edging - this is a bit harder to control. It's ok. Just not thrilled. I do like that the batteries are interchangeable with the blower and hedge trimmer. Update - after using it all summer, it is a horrible purchase. I now have the pieces duct taped together. I wish I had returned it but that was daunting - not one of the oh-so-easy returns I'm used to with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DButler

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I e only used it twice, but a piece of the plastic broke the first time that I used it. It still functions fine, and cuts thru most weeds on the first try. I have a small yard, so I don’t have any issues with the battery life. This is my first battery operated weed eater, and I am impressed with the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Epperson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for a light duty work. Because it's so light, it's easy to maneuver and won't tire you, but it's not something you'd want to throw in the back of a truck. The cord does run out fast, unfortunately. I can do light trimming on my entire yard on a complete charge.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Haberbosch

customer_reviews.title: Great mower - needs 2nd battery
customer_reviews.text: I love the portability of this weed wacker. The only thing i wish it had was a mechanism to leave the unit on without having to constantly holding the power button. Also the battery doesn't last very long, so i think i'll have to purchase a second battery. Otherwise, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Braginsky

customer_reviews.title: Simple and light - does most of what you need
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting top line here so I was OK with what I am getting so far. The batteries last less than half hour it feels but I can get most of what I need in one go. It's very light and easy to use and does a good enough job for simple and basic landscaping needs. The pros is that you dont need to worry about a cord or gas/oil combos - its batteries. It's strong enough for the basic needs - so dont expet to use this for any hardcore landscaping
customer_reviews.author: Marc O

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool
customer_reviews.text: It arrived promptly and had enough charge after an hour to tackle the front lawn which was horribly in need of edging. The tool was powerful enough to cut through pretty thick blades and vines as well as easy to use. Those extremely large vines has to be cut with a shovel as this tool and line aren’t strong enough to handle the job. Overall it’s priced great and I’d certainly purchase again. After more usage I’ll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Queen De

customer_reviews.title: Blown Away
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a gas-powered trimmer. This battery-powered trimmer is lightweight, starts easily, and is whisper-quiet! It's great not worrying about pumping fuel and managing the throttle, but still having reliable power. Its simple conversion to edging to great too! I had forgot to charge the battery the night before, and only plugged it in for 30 minutes, but it quickly charged and I was able to finish my small yard before it died. Hopefully it lasts because I know my dad used to regularly replace his electric trimmers.
customer_reviews.author: Lt Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good product but has some flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, light weight product. However, the battery does not stay charged for a long time. I found myself having to stop my yardwork just to recharge the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Socialbutterfly

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BRAND AND THESE PRODUCTS!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite Cordless weedeater of all time! This is the 2nd one I've had. If I would have known you could purchase just the Spool Cap Cover, I would still be on my first one! I'm a lover of the WORX cordless Lawnmower also! Easiest products ever! I have to be honest though, I purchased the blower and it didn't impress me! Not enough power!
customer_reviews.author: Cliffa R. Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: For the money this is a pretty good little weed eater
customer_reviews.text: I just used this grass trimmer on a 8 x 12 foot section of 2 foot high grass. I ran the trimmer non stop for 25 minutes and cut the grass down to about 3 inches, no problem. Then the battery finally went dead. I have no problem with that, this was a tough job. In the future I will probably run it no more than 15 minutes at a time. For the money this is a pretty good little weed eater. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Hambone99

customer_reviews.title: They work great with the exception of where the handle connects to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these over time. They work great with the exception of where the handle connects to the shaft. It is supposed to click into place but it does not (this has been the case on both I purchased) so when you start using it, they come apart. You have to tape the 2 together somehow. It works fine other than that.
customer_reviews.author: john kish

customer_reviews.title: This is fun!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes cutting my grass a lot of fun. It’s so easy (and I’m a small woman.)
customer_reviews.author: Jenny from the block

customer_reviews.title: weed trimer
customer_reviews.text: After using this trimer the handle broke off the base after the 4 th time of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rhett Butler

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer, single string, battery included, but not interchangeable with other brands.
customer_reviews.text: A nice trimmer for small yards, if your expecting something equal to corded power this is about half. Patience is required with this trimmer having only a single string and turning slower. Torque is good even in heavy grass, also if your thinking about using other 20 volt batteries you own with this forget it, they may look the same but they changed the slide rails and wiring connection. The best thing about this is that there is no more cords to hassle with. For an entry level cordless trimmer this is well made and if your patient with it, this trimmer with 1battery and a charger and string should last you a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Yard Tools
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer at my small town cemetery, This worx brand weed eater works far better then others gas or otherwise. The battery lasts Elon her then Black+Decker. We have all Worx products interchangeable battery. Leaf Blower, Shrub Trimmer, Chain saw. Always can count on power not having to stop. Unfortunately was sent Wrong Weedeater from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: My initial expectations were somewhat low for a battery-powered plastic trimmer but I've been pleasantly surprised that this trimmer can handle my entire 1/3 acre of trimming and edging without any problems. It's not quite as powerful as a gas trimmer, but it trims and edges the bermuda grass just fine and I don't miss the 20 minutes of fiddling with the gas trimmer and the noise and fumes. My only complaint is that the small spools of line don't last long so I keep refills on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kwebo

customer_reviews.title: Still not sure
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ for a month-then kept turning itself off. Just past amazon return window-and it took over 4 hours for worx to return my call. Sounds like this model came out over 7 years ago and is not the current model. However they still have some in stock and will be getting a replacement. Will update when replacement arrives
customer_reviews.author: Amy C

customer_reviews.title: Another great WORX Cordless Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: As I reach 80 years of age I have started to feel much better, both mentally and physically. I still have to have "professional" help with my grounds maintenance/lawn care, but I have a small area I take care of personally to give me a hobby and keep me active. The selection of WORX Cordless Gardening Tools, with a common battery, is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: 20v keeps on going and going...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 12 inch Black and Decker with this Worx 10". At first I noticed it was not as violent as the B&D and the spool is tiny, but at the same time it got the job done. The lithium battery did not run out as the B&D always did. A bonus is I have two other worx tools that use the same 20v battery, so I can carry a spare in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: biker123

customer_reviews.title: Battery life could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little machine for the most part. It is lightweight and easy to handle. However the reason I couldn't give it 5 stars is because the battery life is much less than I anticipated. I have a medium-large yard, and I have had to fully charge it twice and I'm still not done. Between the time it takes to charge, and the time it takes me to trim, I will be starting all over again the next day. I will be purchasing one or two more batteries for it so I might be able to finish the yard in one day.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for LESS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was some what hesitant to buy and electric weed eater. But after a back injury and some other injuries, my body just isn't as capable to handle the gas powered vibrations. After receiving it in the mail, I charged the battery and gave it a go. It was powerful and long lasting for one battery. I will definitely be looking into this company more.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: works on weeds
customer_reviews.text: I said, wife you have ordered junk, believe me I was very wrong. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby N. Salyer

customer_reviews.title: No.
customer_reviews.text: How important is saving money? Important enough to go back to the trimmer you had forty years ago, when every time the line broke, you had to stop and advance it off the spool manually? And the spool is scarcely bigger than the ones for sewing machines. No, I'm going back to the Toro I had before I bought this one. I can't even take this to Goodwill in good conscience.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Bigwood

customer_reviews.title: Night and day
customer_reviews.text: I owned a comparable Toro for ten years; it finally croaked. This WORX product is superior. It's not heavy duty, but neither are my lawn projects. It's lighter in weight and "friendly" in my hands, far exceeding the Toro. As for the battery life, that is unknown. It lasted an entire yard in its first use. It's quieter as well.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Marshall Smith

customer_reviews.title: In full agreement with others who state this trimmer isn't ...
customer_reviews.text: In full agreement with others who state this trimmer isn't as powerful as a gas one, but I knew that before I bought it. Auto line feed doesn't seem to work every time, even though I stop and start the trimmer (which according to the owner's manual should work). Fully charged battery lasts more than enough for my purposes. I just hope the trimmer lasts at least 4-5 years, don't think that's asking too much.
customer_reviews.author: Joe V

customer_reviews.title: perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to describe how much I love all the WORX tools. This trimmer is just the right size for me and my yard. It is light weight, doesn't make my arm or shoulder hurt to use it. It is easy to put the battery on and take off. So easy to manipulate from trimming to edging. Sturdy, nicely made, very well thought out! I can't say enough except that you should definitely get one.
customer_reviews.author: pecan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, especially!!! High quality!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this and it is super quality! The battery life isn’t super amazing but the quality and the weight of this is absolutely overlooked by the battery life. The battery lasted about 30 minutes of high intense weed whacking. But this is a really great high-quality product and well worth the price! I am so happy I read the reviews and went with it
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Butenschoen

customer_reviews.title: I am really impressed with this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I took my time and read the instruction manual. This is my first trimmer with auto-feed. Even though it wastes a little string, it's always ready without bumping. Replacement spools of string are dirt cheap too. This trimmer is really light weight and easy to operate. Edging a lawn takes a little practice but my first time made my lawn look like a masterpiece. I'm sure the neighbors took notice.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time today and it was awesome! After reading many reviews I already didnt expect the battery to last for the whole yard and it didn't but I had done a lot of trimming and some patches of pretty thick weeds at that. I plan on buying another battery soon. Very easy to use and lightweight. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is not the trimmer for you if your yard is huge or you're working against some heavy duty weeds. I bought this with that in mind because I live in the suburbs. Overgrown grass is the toughest thing I'm going to encounter, and my yard isn't even a full acre. This handles it well. Only complaints are that my hand gets a little tired holding down the 'on' trigger and the angle is a bit funny. But for the whopping 5-6 times I'll use it this summer, it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: PinkDeath

customer_reviews.title: Not enough battery life
customer_reviews.text: It works really well but battery on a full charge only last 20 minutes. I would suggest ordering a extra battery if you have alot to do. Other than that it's literally and works great.
customer_reviews.author: heather millswood

customer_reviews.title: Great option for a cheap cordless edger and weed eater
customer_reviews.text: This works great if you have a small amount of edge work and hard to reach corners. Battery charge and overall power was a little better than I expected. The only thing to watch out for is there is alot of cheap plastic, and I would not use this for heavy duty jobs. Overall, so far I am happy with this purchase, given my light duty lawn needs and the price point with the battery. May consider other products from Worx in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy, reliable, simple tool.
customer_reviews.text: Light, easy, everything works. I cant vouch for it as a heavy duty professional tool, but for touch ups and maintenance around the place, it is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Carlick

customer_reviews.title: Easily handled by a woman.
customer_reviews.text: I bought due to a recomendation from my nephew. My husband is recovering from a trama hip replacement and not able to due outside work. I was preparing for a hip replacement and had sciatica. This weedwacker was thw perfect solution for me. I said if I cannot bend to pull weeds I will wack them off. I have an acre of many flower beds and this is perfect for me. The battery lenght was the limit of how ling I could walk withpot a cane. I can be very specific about how close to my flowers I can get. Perfect for a senior citizen and my nephew thinks it is cool that I can use and like the Worx.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor Swogger

customer_reviews.title: My edges look fab!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a corded electric string trimmer for years and I almost never pull it out because I don't want to deal with the cord. I decided to spring for this one and I"m SO glad I did! It's lightweight, easy to put together, and I am really pleased with the purchase. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jesseca

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: It's light weight and easy to use. Can't get the head to turn to use it for edging. I knew for the price it wasn't going to be "the best" but it will work for me, just not the edging which I don't have a lot of places for edging. Haven't used it for long periods of time so I can't comment on the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first battery operated weedeater, wish I would have made the switch years ago! Mostly used around our pool, porches. It is so powerful, and so lightweight! I bought an extra battery, but haven't even had to use it yet, did the area I wanted to do on one battery. I'm disabled and don't have much upper body strength, so a gas powered weedeater is difficult to use, this is perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Mishe B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used mine 3 times since I purchased it. I might rate it higher once I use it more. However, I'm impressed and it did a great job around my place. Certainly powerful and didn't run down in the times I used it. I much prefer this type then gas version, less to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: JonP

customer_reviews.title: best trimmer I have owned in 40 years
customer_reviews.text: Best trimmer I have ever owned. The gas powered two and four stroke trimmers were too heavy and poorly designed, ie gas caps positioned toward the ground so leaking and sealing a hassle. Also the ryobi head wears out quickly and feeds line poorly. This trimmer lasts long and trim string is strong. Love the swivel to use as edger and it is light enough to hold a steady cut.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen R. Janoco

customer_reviews.title: Dependable easy use trimmer
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use it's done great. Never owned another trimmer so I can't really compare it but it's not heavy the battery holds a good charge and is easy to remove and charge. The only annoying thing is the need to hold two buttons to make the wire spin. But that's how most trimmers are it seems. Plus I know it's for safety so can't really hate it all in great. My lawn is pretty average size and I've actually used it one week and then again the next week without charging and it didn't die for perspective on the battery. Generally I just charge the battery the day of before using
customer_reviews.author: Treasure hunter Mike

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - battery only has ~15 min run time
customer_reviews.text: I would never recommend this to a friend. The battery life is ridiculously low - I've used it twice now and each time the battery lasted less than 15 minutes on a full charge. It could be a defective battery, but I'm extremely disappointed in my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TME

customer_reviews.title: Ran for 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Initial impression was it was lightweight and super easy to assemble. But then it only ran for 20 minutes on a full battery before either dying or overheating. Disappointed and glad I can return it
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Second time purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the same model trimmer for more than three years. Being a petite woman in my 60's, I appreciate that it is easy to use. I wanted to be sure to have a replacement when the original fails to work. I am just as happy with my new trimmer. It helps to have an extra battery. I can normally finish trimming my yard with the two batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Best Weed Wacker I have Used
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman without a lot of upper body strength and I find this weed wacker to be perfect. It is light weight, it really chomps through some pretty thick stuff, the battery lasts a long time, and the guard makes me feel safe. It is the best weed wacker I have used. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri - Family Shopper

customer_reviews.title: My favorite garden tool!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this trimmer. I have limited strength in my arms but I am able to use this machine easily. It works great and is a blast to use.
customer_reviews.author: NJB Dimples

customer_reviews.title: Battery dies within minutes! And it’s brand new!
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this item. The batter takes 5 hours to charge and dies within 20 minutes of use. I have a tiny yard and it’s still not enough charge to finish my yard. I bought it at the end of the summer last year but didn’t use it till the first time this week. I’ve used it twice now and I’m so upset I’m ready to throw it in the trash. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: ashley fuell

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: this weed wacker is junk !! not worth my time or money !! we don`t find out until you try it then its junk !! wtf !!
customer_reviews.author: raynad2

customer_reviews.title: WORX Trimmer/Edger
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is light weight, has a decent battery life and the string feeds like it is supposed to. Being that I am a woman and that mechanically inclined, it was easy for me to understand the makeup and how it works. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Kozel

customer_reviews.title: AdVISORY: Buy extra batteries
customer_reviews.text: Better buy an extra battery! I get 20 minutes TOPS and then it’s dead and takes forever to recharge. It’s really great for 20 minutes like a sprinter running a marathon. I wouldn’t but again or recommend without having at least two or three batteries.
customer_reviews.author: mickeyhsd

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The automatic line advancing feature works. This is the only trimmer I have ever owned where this is the case. Light weight is makes using it a breeze. Certainly not commercial grade....but is fine for household use. Ability to use as an edger is also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kent K Peckham

customer_reviews.title: Worx  WG154 String Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Love, Love, Love It !!! My old one stopped working after 20 some years, another brand. I chanced this one since I seen it didn't have those wheels on it for edging. To me it is easier without them, my son uses that one but he doesn't edge. I do more edging than trimming. I did the front yard and back yard and never ran out of power. I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Melodie

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this one!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known about this years ago. No more begging hubby to start the gas one for me. Battery runs out fast though. Try to buy one with 2 batteries or buy another battery. Love this garden tool.
customer_reviews.author: E. Capretto

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get two batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay product. The battery life is about a half an hour that's why you should get two batteries if you want to finish the job you're doing. I like the fact that I don't have a cord that I have to worry about. The string is kind of short so you have to be right in there but it does the job and I'm somewhat satisfied
customer_reviews.author: teresa zajac

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it it’s garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worst thing I ever bought. Ever 30 seconds or less u have to stop and hang feed the line because it breaks. The line won’t self feed it’s garbage don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this yesterday, and it’s all good except when in the edger mode, it fails to feed string. I kept needing to take the spool out and re-feed it. Very irritating. Did my whole yard without losing the charge, but my yard isn’t huge. It would be a 5 star if not for the feed problem.
customer_reviews.author: brightonrunner

customer_reviews.title: No problems
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now with no problems. It comes with directions to put together, which is really just connecting a couple of pieces; very simple. Very light weight. After an hour or two of use you will need to recharge, and the initial charging time period is around 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Trim line a little to thin
customer_reviews.text: Nice trimmer with decent battery life. Now keep this in mind, this is a lightweight trimmer, made for light duty yard work. I think the trimming line is to thin, hense the 4 star rating. It does go through trimming line a bit to fast in my opinion. Other than that, I like it. My yard is small, so this trimmer is great for that.
customer_reviews.author: ke0fnz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, 30 minute battery
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate being able to use this without hurting my hands or arms. Very light and easy to use. The battery lasts for about 30 minute fully charged and it takes me lomger.than that to complete my entire yard. I still love this for its light weight and easy operation.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Colon

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations!! I looked for something light that won’t hurt my back and will do the job. This weed whacker is very light, easy to grab and go do the job. I have two acre property with only one half landscaped. Can trim around the house, pool, barn, pump house and landscaping in one go. Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Magda

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really wish the battery even had another 10 minutes in it. It dies after about 25 minutes of use. That being said for the price and it being cordless I will take it. If you’re on a budget and or have a small space, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Leigh Lozinak

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weed whacker/trimmer and a Worx Edger/Trencher at the same time. The edger/trencher works GREAT but unfortunately this trimmer is extremely sub-par. The battery life isn't even enough to 1/4 of our back yard along the fence and it's much weaker than our old corded model. I would recommend getting a corded or gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: GeekSage

customer_reviews.title: great trimmer and edger
customer_reviews.text: Works great for both trimming and edging - very easy to switch between the modes. Can trim small clover weeds as well as a few larger ones. Not great with fibrous weeds - probably too much to ask! Battery lasts ~30 min - charging is slow (~4-5 h). Overall great product. We are happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tejaswini Kale

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!!
customer_reviews.text: This is quite the work horse for such a small light weigh weed eater. It’s perfect for a woman. Battery has up to an hour of trimming. It even handles some pretty big weeds. I was very surprised at how well it does. I highly recommend as a favorite go to weed eater!! After trying to start gas weed eaters, a battery is the only way to go for regular maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte A.

customer_reviews.title: Battery drains quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to tackle the tall grass that had grown (I just moved into a new house where the front and back yards were turning into a mini jungle). It works very well, but the battery doesn't last long, so the yard work is incomplete. It didn't seem like it lasted an hour, and I charged the battery overnight. If only the battery lasted much longer, I would have given this more stars.
customer_reviews.author: Liz M.

customer_reviews.title: Short life battery, short life product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for trimming our yard, and it worked nicely for a couple months, and the battery sits on the charger when not in use. But the battery only works for about two minutes, rendering its usefulness zero.
customer_reviews.author: neptune mick

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use--light weight yet manges the trimming of lawns really well.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Wheadon

customer_reviews.title: Manageable by a small woman
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of a toy, but that's what I expected. Good for touch up trimming; I am small and not strong, so was afraid it would be impossible for me to use; it's not. It does not have the power of a regular string trimmer, but that's ok for my purposes. I just wanted to cut the tops off weeds before they go to seed. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: KellyGreenOrganic

customer_reviews.title: Bought for son in law, says its great and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these already and my son in law needed a weed whacker. So I purchased this for him. They are really good cutters and work very well. Plus I like that all my 20v worx cordless power tools all use the same battery. The string is cheap to buy right here on amazon. I really like this and so does my son in law for your average city lawn work.
customer_reviews.author: THXkid61

customer_reviews.title: A Little Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of battery operated - The only issue I am having is the chord releases too much - I have to keep winding it back in. Not Good!
customer_reviews.author: C & O

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is a beast! The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the battery life. I was so impressed with the performance for such a lightweight little battery operated weed whacker. I get 25-30 minutes of heavy duty whacking. Thick tall grass and weeds couldn't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: inheaven

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY!!️
customer_reviews.text: VERY EASY TO PUT TOGETHER WORK GREAT TRUST ME IF YOU A SINGLE WOMAN AND HAVE NO ONE TO CUT YOUR GRASS I ADVISE YOU TO PURCHASE THIS ..YOU WON’T BE DISAPPOINTED I’M EXTREMELY HAPPY & HIGHLY SATISFIED...THANK YOU DEFINITELY A ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ NOT ONLY THE EQUIPMENT BUT BATTERY 🔋
customer_reviews.author: Humble

product_meta.title: WORX WG154 Edger 20V 10" Cordless String Trimmer
product_meta.description: Style:TrimmerThe WORX WG154 is a compact & light weight cordless trimmer that quickly converts from a trimmer to an edger & vise-versa in S. There is a one touch easy, no-tool conversion to go from one function to the other. The trimmer/Edger runs on a 20V lithium battery for longer run time & has a fixed front handle for comfort & control. The WG154 has an adjustable cutting width from 10" To 12" For extended run time & cutting path. The folding spacer guard helps protect flowers & ornamental landscaping.
feature_bullets: Convert trimmer easily to an edger and vice versa in seconds
Convert the cutting path for a wider cut or extended run time
Fixed ergonomic front handle for maximum control. Charging time: ≈ 5 hours
100 percentage automatic single line feed for best cutting performance
Rotating head for easy edger conversion

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,189 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
